column2: Kushikino-shi) is the name of a former city municipality located in Kagoshima Prefecture
column3: Japan. It was founded under that name on 1 October 1950.
355 inhabitants and covered an area 80.46 km²
column4: giving a population density of 327.55 persons per km².

column2: Kushikino and the town of Ichiki (part of Hioki District) were merged to form the new city of Ichikikushikino
column3: so that Kushikino no longer exists as an independent municipality.
